contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Paris metro |Name=Porte d'Italie |Pic=[[File:Metro 7 Porte d Italie accès.JPG|275px]] |Day=7 March |Year=1930 |Access= |Municipality=the 13th arrondissement of Paris |Zone=1 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next|7|Porte de Choisy|Maison Blanche }} | X=159 | Y=149 }} '''Porte d'Italie''' is a station of the [[Paris Métro]], serving [[Paris Métro Line 7|Line 7]] and [[Paris Tramway Line 3a|Tramway Line 3a]]. The station opened on 7 March 1930 as part of [[Paris Métro Line 10|Line 10]] when it was extended from [[Place d'Italie (Paris Métro)|Place d'Italie]] to [[Porte de Choisy (Paris Métro)|Porte de Choisy]]. The station was integrated into line 7 on 26 April 1931. In 2006, [[Paris Tramway Line 3]] (now 3a) opened, with a stop at ''Porte d'Italie''. It is named after the ''Porte d'Italie'', a [[City gates of Paris|gate]] in the nineteenth century [[Thiers wall]] of Paris, which led to the south and [[Italy]]. ==Gallery== <gallery widths="200px" heights="125px" perrow="2"> File:Metro 7 Porte d Italie quais.JPG|[[Paris Métro Line 7|Line 7]] platforms at Porte d'Italie File:Metro 7 Porte d Italie tramway.JPG|Porte d'Italie [[Paris Tramway Line 3|T3 tram]] stop </gallery> ==References== {{reflist}} {{commons category|Porte d'Italie (Paris Metro)}} {{Paris Metro/line 7}} {{coord|48.819196|N|2.360805|E|region:FR_type:landmark_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1930]] {{Paris-metro-stub}}
